item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:31, topic:534100”]class RemindTask extends TimerTask { public void run() { //execute timer.cancel(); //Terminate the timer thread } }

class RemindThread implements Runnable {
        public void run() {
            //execute
        }
    }

so much more work

You use a timer for executing in the future, and as I said before it would probably WORK, but is not the best practice depending on the exact purpose of this code. The reason being there might be code that is executed before all of this, and after all of this, that could be grouped up into the same thread as well which would be better design. If you would stop being an egotistical asshat you would realize I’m just trying to help people and you’re getting defensive about it.[/quote]

Thank you. I don’t understand why people fail to realize that just because something works doesn’t mean it’s the way it should be done, and that often times, the client has no idea wtf he’s talking about, or wtf he wants… sigh

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:25, topic:534100”]I think you’re beginning to forget how shitty of a programmer you really are. You’re stepping a bit out of your place lately. You have absolutely no programming knowledge nor do you have a reason to be acting like such an ignorant douche.

Edit: Better add a rofl to show my conceited nature, right? cough [size=2pt]dick[/size] cough[/quote][quote=“eyeownyew, post:25, topic:534100”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=652898.msg4374949#msg4374949 date=1381812053]

Er, if he wants to pause one certain operation making an entirely new thread would be unnecessary. A timer would work just fine.

A timer IS a different thread…
[/quote]
More than aware of that. If it didn’t it would still pause the program, figured that was a given, sir
If he were to be making his own implementation, he would quite literally be making his own timer rather than using the one provided. That’s illogical as it literally has no advantage and would require more work on his end.[/quote]

class RemindTask extends TimerTask { public void run() { //execute timer.cancel(); //Terminate the timer thread } }

class RemindThread implements Runnable {
        public void run() {
            //execute
        }
    }

so much more work

You use a timer for executing in the future, and as I said before it would probably WORK, but is not the best practice depending on the exact purpose of this code. The reason being there might be code that is executed before all of this, and after all of this, that could be grouped up into the same thread as well which would be better design. If you would stop being an egotistical asshat you would realize I’m just trying to help people and you’re getting defensive about it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:28, topic:534100”][quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=652898.msg4374961#msg4374961 date=1381813131]

[quote author=imthenull link=topic=652898.msg4374953#msg4374953 date=1381812769]

This is how I’d do it, excuse any code errors, due to being typed in the quick reply:

int pauseFor = 5000; // 5 seconds.
long pauseTime;
while (running) {
    if (!paused) {
        // Update logic or anything you want to be able to pause.
        // Client pressed 'p' for example, pause the game:
        paused = true;
        pauseTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
    } else {
        paused = (System.currentTimeMillis() - pauseTime >= pauseTime);
    }
}

[/quote]?
[/quote]an implication your code is a resource hog.[/quote]I’m not going to write an entire engine for them that handles sleeping to get the desired ups and fps? I didn’t write an entire program, but an example of how to prevent certain logic from being executed if the client was in a ‘paused’ state.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Kiryn, post:16, topic:534100”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=652898.msg4374937#msg4374937 date=1381809677]

In case you don’t know how to read. he says:

facepalm

He didn’t describe what he’s trying to do, in the OP, therefore it was impossible to point him in the right direction. Don’t just blindly point someone at some random documentation for something that does what you THINK they want to do.
[/quote]

he said he wanted a timer. so I linked him to the timer class in the API…?[/quote]

And what I was saying was that with the very little information the OP provided to begin with, simply going with a timer may not have been the best solution, or even the proper one if it had turned out he wasn’t properly expressing himself, which happens very often.

eyeownyew:

Er, if he wants to pause one certain operation making an entirely new thread would be unnecessary. A timer would work just fine.

A timer IS a different thread…

Read full topic
